name: Unchained
title: Bitfinex Restitution, Trumpâ€™s Crypto Overhaul: Weekly Recap
text:
Synopsis
The cryptocurrency landscape is experiencing significant regulatory and strategic shifts, with potential policy changes under a potential Trump administration, major restitution events, and ongoing legal battles that could reshape the industry's regulatory framework.

Key Insights
- US Department of Justice to return 990,000 Bitcoin (valued at $9 billion) to Bitfinex, resolving a 2016 hack
- Tether is relocating to El Salvador, receiving a digital asset service provider license
- SEC has filed an appeal challenging the previous ruling that XRP is not a security when sold to retail investors
- Coinbase won a legal victory, with a court ordering the SEC to provide a clearer explanation of cryptocurrency regulations
- BitMEX fined an additional $100 million for violating anti-money laundering and know-your-customer rules
- Speculation about a potential "America First" crypto reserve under a Trump administration, with XRP surging 13.4% on related rumors
- Jupiter (Solana-based platform) preparing a $575 million token airdrop to 2 million eligible wallets
- Ethereum Foundation revamping its social media strategy to improve community engagement
- Chainlink facing controversy over a whale exploiting staking limits by using multiple wallets
- Pump.fun, a Solana meme coin platform, facing potential legal action for potentially unethical practices
